projects.postExcerpt: My new DJ website has finally landed, spurred on by the fact I desperately needed to find somewhere to host my new APC-40 midi template, I have finally created my DJ website...

projects.postExcerpt: So here we are, version 3 of my personal website. Building your own website is always a great opportunity to learn new things..

projects.postExcerpt: This custom built Wordpress CMS powered website is highly responsive and should work across all devices and also features retina ready graphics...

projects.postExcerpt: Combining two of my favorite loves, football and building websites made me very happy indeed when working on this project. This website/application allows users to login and make predictions for the upcoming football matches.

projects.postExcerpt: Feed is a music app for iPad that enables complex, rich manipulation of a “live feed” of sound, drawn from the ipad microphone or any audio file. For this website I was asked to develop a bespoke CMS using Wordpress...
Damian Evans Design offers wide ranging design services including tableware, kitchen products, furniture, lighting etc. I developed this website as a bespoke Wordpress CMS to showcase his products...

Incidental is a small organisation specialising in cross-disciplinary creative work. I was approached by the founder to recode the old website, make it cross browser compatible and turn it into a fully customisable CMS.

SellaBike is a mobile app created to make the process of buying and selling motorbikes faster, easier and cheaper. I built this Wordpress driven CMS website for them to promote the app and also engage with the users...
Working within a team of developers using a bespoke PHP framework we delivered valid, accessible, cross browser XHTML, CSS and JS/jQuery across all channels of this website.
It may be the old version of this site, but after the many hours spent slaving away over it back in the day I thought it only fair to feature it as I reckon it's still a pretty cool site.

projects.postExcerpt: The designs have undergone several iterations since the first wireframes were handed to me back in 2006 where I became Lead Creative for this project. The biggest challenge was to design a content driven website that supports multiple languages...

My original portfolio was created back in 2005 when I finished university. This was not the most accessible Flash website in the world, but served a purpose showcasing all my final year projects at that time.

projects.postTitle: Custom APC40 Python Scripts for Ableton
projects.postExcerpt: I took it upon myself (what was I thinking!) to learn Python from scratch so I could manually edit the decompiled scripts that power the APC-40 and introduce a whole load of new functionality...
After coming across an early demo of my Master Blaster game I was approached by the UK’s largest paintballing company to design and develop them an online flash game.

This is my first attempt at creating a flash game, its still only 8% complete, but most of the gameplay dynamics are in place. This game has been gaining a lot of interest from various gaming websites...
This Flash application is intended to give the audience a glimpse of a typical student household. There are 2 rooms available to interact with, with nearly every item making a sound.

This interactive CD-ROM was created to present information about one of Leicester’s famous riverside walks. Features include an interactive tour, along with information about the history, wildlife and places of interest one may see while on the walk.

metadata.metaDesc: Quirksmode is a fully responsive Universal React Application connected to a Headless CMS designed and developed by myself, web enthusiast and all round nice guy Dave. It was created to be my Portfolio and voice to the world
